greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes p <= 6*n + 1 that are congruent to 1 modulo 3.
link: Jianing Song, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: There are 11 primes <= 6*16+1 = 97 that are congruent to 1 modulo 3, namely 7, 13, 19, 31, 37, 43, 61, 67, 73, 79, 97, so a(16) = 11.
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Apr 28 2021
